newsitem.title: INDONESIA: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch Jan 31.
newsitem.headline: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch Jan 31.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors likely to affect Indonesian stocks on Friday:

* On Thursday, the Dow Jones industrial average gained 83 points to 6,823.86, putting the average back within reach of its all-time closing high of 6,883.90 set on January 21. The rise came on the back of a broad rally, as blue chips continued to reverse the damage from recent sell-offs.
* A mob of Indonesian Moslems burned and wrecked churches and temples east of Jakarta on Thursday after reports that a Christian had insulted Moslems, officials and eyewitnesses said.
* Indonesia continued to commit serious human rights abuses in 1996, including in East Timor, the United States said.

* United Nations chief Kofi Annan said on Thursday that Portugal and Indonesia were ready to revive U.N.-sponsored talks on East Timor and he hoped the two sides could reach agreement quickly on the troubled territory.
MARKETS
* On Thursday, the composite index fell 4.04 points, or 0.58 percent, to close at 687.29 points after touching an intra-day low of 685.58 points.
* On Friday morning, spot rupiah was quoted at 2,377.0/78.0 at 0200 GMT, compared with Thursday close at 2,373.20/73.50.
STOCKS TO WATCH
* PT Tambang Timah on news it has signed an MOU with Mohammad Hasan to take part in the Busang gold project.
* PT Bakrie Brothers on plan to sell 49 percent share of PT Indocopper Investama Corp, which has a stake in PT Freeport Indonesia, subject to shareholders' approval in March.
* PT Bakrie Brothers on its plan to sell 20 percent of its stake in coal mining firm PT Arutmin.
* PT Astra Graphia on news it targeted sales growth of 70 percent this year.
* PT Multipolar Corp after winning shareholders' approval on Thursday to take a 50.1 percent controlling interest in retailer PT Matahari Putra Prima.
* PT Barito Pacific on rumours that new investors may enter Indonesia's largest plywood firm.
* PT Lippo Life on news it had revised up its 1996 net profit target to 130.8 billion rupiah from 100.3 billion rupiah initially.
* PT Great River Industries on news it targeted sales of 360 billion rupiah in 1997.
* Indosat on news it would join 12 Asian telecommunication firms, including Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Corp, to form multimedia forum
* State-controlled Bank Negara Indonesia on its denial of merger talk with state-owned Bank Tabungan Negara.
-- Jakarta newsroom +6221 384-6364
